Začetek konca? Levica v opozicijo
Luka Mesec pravi, da zdaj niso več zavezani koaliciji, s katero so se prej pogodili s sporazumom.
06 Nov 2019, 16:02 by STA, Ma. M.
LJUBLJANA – Koordinator Levice Luka Mesec je opozoril, da bi koalicija s sprejemom dopolnil povozila predlog Levice za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja. »Padla je še zadnja domina, ugotavljamo, da je vlada dokončno prekinila sodelovanje in odstopila od dogovora z nami,« je dejal Mesec.Odbor DZ za zdravstvo je bil danes po napovedi koalicije, da bo vložila dopolnila, prekinjen. A v Levici ugotavljajo, da je koalicija pokazala svoje nestrinjanje s predlogom Levice, ob čemer je Mesec izpostavil zlasti namen solidarnostnega plačevanja zavarovanja. Med drugim je omenil še spremembe dohodninske lestvice, ukinitev dodatka za delovno aktivnost in proračun. Sporazum, ki so ga sklenili z vlado, tako po besedah Mesca za Levico ni več zavezujoč in so odslej v polni opoziciji.Premier Marjan Šarec je prepričan, da ni vlada tista, ki bi zapuščala Levico, ampak je lahko prej obratno. Šarec je ob robu odprtja pohištvenega sejma v Ljubljani že pred tem dejal, da je svoje, kar se tiče Levice, že povedal in da si sodelovanja ne želi prekiniti. Znova je obžaloval politiko ultimatov oziroma vsakokratnega zaostrovanja, saj ocenjuje, da se da v tišini in v nekem normalnem dialogu veliko narediti. »Je pa res, da bi od Levice tudi pričakoval nekaj več potrpežljivosti, kajti veliko projektov smo izvedli skupaj in tudi ti projekti, ki se že izvajajo, so v sodelovanju z Levico. Niso pa vsi njihovi projekti izvedljivi na ta način, kot si oni zamišljajo.« Poudaril je, da je LMŠ kot sredinska stranka pripravljena na kompromise in jih tudi sprejema. »Politika je pač kompromis, zlasti v demokraciji in zlasti pri manjšinski vladi.« Opozoril je, da ukinitve dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja že pretekle večinske vlade z manj partnerji niso bile sposobne izpeljati. »Potem si ne smemo nič očitati, če tej manjšinski vladi to ne bo uspelo.« Obenem pa je poudaril, da ne obupuje, in ponovil, da lahko zakonodajo sprejmejo le, če bodo vsi vložili napor v iskanje kompromisa.

The beginning of the end? Left to opposition
Luke Moon says they are no longer committed to the coalition they had previously agreed to.
06 Nov 2019, 15:02 by STA, Ma. M.
LJUBLJANA - Levica Coordinator Luka Mesec has warned that by accepting the coalition, it would overrule Levica's proposal to terminate supplementary health insurance. "The last domino has fallen, and we note that the government has finally discontinued cooperation and withdrew from the agreement with us," the moon said. But in the Left, they note that the coalition has shown its disagreement with the proposal of the Left, emphasizing in particular the purpose of the solidarity payment of insurance. Among other things, he mentioned changes in the income tax scale, the abolition of the allowance for work activity and the budget. According to the Moon, the agreement they have made with the government is no longer binding, and they are now in full opposition. On the sidelines of the opening of the furniture fair in Ljubljana, Šarec had earlier said that he had already said his own, as far as Levica was concerned, and that he did not want to interrupt his cooperation. He again regretted the policy of ultimatums, or the tightening of the case, since he said that much could be done in silence and in some normal dialogue. “It is true that I would also expect some more patience from Levica, because many projects have been implemented together and these projects that are already underway are in cooperation with Levica. However, not all of their projects are as viable as they imagine. "He emphasized that LMS as a center party is ready for compromise and accepts them. "Politics is a compromise, especially in a democracy, and especially in a minority government." He noted that the abolition of supplementary health insurance by the previous majority government with fewer partners was not able to deliver. "Then we should not blame ourselves if this minority government fails to do so." At the same time, he stressed that he did not despair and reiterated that they could pass legislation only if everyone made an effort to find a compromise.
